DOC.brief_summary: The primary purpose of this study is to evaluate the effectiveness in pediatric subjects of three different strengths of resiquimod gel applied to common wart(s) three times a week for four weeks. A second purpose is to evaluate the safety of the drug.
DOC.brief_title: Four Week Safety and Efficacy Study With a Topical Gel to Treat Common Warts in Pediatric Subjects
DOC.criteria: Diagnosis of common warts Ages between 3 to 11 Other types of wart(s), ie. plantar Currently participating in another clinical study Chronic viral hepatitis B or C
